Entries.default:
"I say if the gods sent you to Ukaizo, it was a cruel joke." Aruihi clutches his side and winces. 

His armor is bloodied and a faint wheeze escapes him with every breath.
"I can still be your ally if you feel like signing over Ukaizo to the Republics."

"Did you think you could hide from vengeance here? Onekaza's wrath did not die with her." 

Aruihi levels his gaze and cracks his knuckles.
"You would have made a useful ally. Instead you will join the other nameless corpses."
"Rauatai is here to stay. Cooperate or die."
"The Príncipi need a home. You let this one rot."
"I didn't come here to make allies. I came for my soul."
"You insult the stones of this great city." Aruihi narrows his eyes.
"We both went through a lot to get here. Can't we negotiate?"
[Attack] "You first, my prince."

"Warriors, let your spears fly with the fury of our ancestors!"

He glances back and passes each of the loyal fighters a look of recognition and respect.
"Vengeance for Onekaza!" He raises his arm and brings it down to signal the assault.
"For Ukaizo!" He raises his arm and brings it down to signal the assault.
"More empty terms of surrender? Not here, I say. Not on Ukaizo."
"Ngati's chosen... were you born to unravel everything we built? Was this your mother's wish?"
"I do not speak for my mother, Aruihi. I... ekera, I never did."
"The priest who read your omens must have been blind. You are savior only to yourself." Aruihi shakes his head and returns his focus to you.
"Captain, I..." Tekēhu swallows and fights to form words.

"I'm sorry that we're here. Ukaizo... this should be a celebration, not a bloodbath."

He looks out upon the city, the enormity of it only now becoming clear.
"Waste not another breath, Tekēhu. Ngati isn't finished with us yet." Aruihi grips his weapon and stares you down.
